pinyin: Ou1 zhou1 Ge1 chang4 Da4 sai4

sentences.english: It was just his vulgar way of showing off.
sentences.chinese: 那樣子就像歌唱演員表演似的，完全是庸俗的炫耀。

sentences.english: We will fight, for what she sings of is beautiful and good.
sentences.chinese: 我們一定會投身戰鬥的，因爲她所歌唱的是美與善。

sentences.english: In the country, he can hear the birds singing and sheep bleating .
sentences.chinese: 在鄉下，他能聽到鳥兒歌唱和羊的叫聲。

sentences.english: Vocalizing is a higher nervous activity of the human being.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱發聲是人的一種高級神經活動。

sentences.english: A blackbird was warbling from the branch.
sentences.chinese: 一隻畫眉鳥在枝頭歌唱。

sentences.english: Bees are busy working and birds are singing in the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂忙着工作，小鳥在藍天中歌唱。

sentences.english: On Sunday morning we had singing lessons with Vishnu.
sentences.chinese: 星期天的早晨，我們上毗溼紐的歌唱課。

sentences.english: It's the holding hands and singing.
sentences.chinese: 是手牽着手一起歌唱的快樂。

sentences.english: I sing about my right foot.
Balladry says Song is not vocal only.
Model your thoughts after the Psalmists of old.
sentences.chinese: 在舊約聖歌唱完之後讓你的思想成形。
去歌唱吧，猶如無人在一邊諦聽。

sentences.english: Each singer must take an active part in the performance.
sentences.chinese: 在歌唱的藝術表現中，每個演唱者還必須積極投入。

sentences.english: The sun never sang to me so bright.
sentences.chinese: 陽光也對我歌唱，從未如此的歡快。

sentences.english: The singer made his debut as Mozart's Don Giovanni.
sentences.chinese: 這位歌唱家初次登臺表演莫札特的唐喬凡尼。

definition: singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
to sing at the top of one's voice (idiom)
sung performance/to sing for an audience
to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
